title.narrative: Strengthening Forecast-based Early Actions in Cyclone Prone coastal regions in Bangladesh (STEP)

description.narrative: Improving local DRM governance by strengthening the capacity of institutions/ communities in identifying and managing risks of natural hazard through forecast based early actions.

The proposed project intends to serve the socioeconomically vulnerable and at-risk populations living in the cyclone prone areas targeted by the project. The action will provide facilitation to 305 DMC members (1 UzDMC, 2 UDMC and 18 WDMC) ; 2 Shelter Management Committee (SMCs) will be targeted for capacity building for improved gender responsive shelter management (14 individual, each SMC comprised of 7 members); 22 Community Based Organizations (CBOs) in the targeted unions among the CBOs, 18 will be the Women Committee (one women committee in each ward), 2 Youth Groups (One in each union)and 2 Adolescent Clubs (one in each union) of these CBOs (330 individuals) will be the direct beneficiaries; A pilot initiative for FbF for most vulnerable households in 2 unions to support 100 most vulnerable households (450 individual); conduct court yard session on risk information sharing and risk transfer at household level and planned to reach 550 members.

The southern & south-western coastal areas of Bangladesh are particularly vulnerable to cyclones, in terms of frequency, intensity, uncertainty and scale of impact. Among coastal populations, poor people who rely on small scale agriculture and wage labor are the main victims of cyclones. In most cases of cyclone hit, they lose all of their means of livelihood. The proposed action intends to strengthen resilience of institutions and cyclone vulnerable communities through improving DRM governance. It aims to improve local DRM governance by strengthening institutions/communities in identifying & managing risks through FBA. This will enable coordination and collaboration between FbF/A taskforce, implementing agencies, communities and the local authorities.
